header.title: ACE Referral Mod
header.description:
ACE Referral Mod is an addition to phpBB3 including invitation features. It enables your users to draw their friends' attention to your board by sending them an invitation e-mail with a registration key attached. ACE Referral Mod is highly configurable and you cannot only decide whether the attached key is required to register or not, but you can also keep track of who invited whom, limit the amount of invitations and add more social features. Supports Ultimate Points and Cash Mod.
This mod continues on from Bycoja's Invite a Friend Mod at v0.6.1
header.author-notes: Update instructions from previous releases can be found within the contrib/updates folder. For further information and bug reports please visit http://www.phpbb.com/community/viewtopic.php?f=70&t=1224005

[Fixed] Disable the invitation class correctly while installing
[Fixed] Unnecessary include of AutoMOD files in the installation file

[Fixed] SQL error when adding new bots
[Added] Advanced profile statistics (percent of total invitations, etc.)
[Added] Search for specific actions within the invitation log
[Added] Search for members by invitation related criteria
[Added] Log administrator actions for the invitation log
[Added] List of possible wildcards in templates
[Changed] List of invited users in profile has been removed as you can search for members now
[Improved] Show queue time in the related error message
[Improved] Show invitation limit in the related error message
[Improved] Invitation form looks more appealing now
[Fixed] Encode usernames in the registration url
[Fixed] Disable the whole modification will actually disable it now

action-group.diy-instructions:
Delete the install folder afterwards, go to your Administrator Control Panel and be sure that the settings and permissions added during the installation are as you would like them.
Have fun.
Note: You might want to install the templates for subsilver2 style or the one of the language packages as well. Related instructions are included in the contrib/templates or contrib/languages folder if not carried out yet.
